abstract: Bets by some of the same banks that helped Greece shroud its mounting debts may actually now be pushing the nation closer to the brink of financial ruin.
snippet: Bets by some of the same banks that helped Greece shroud its mounting debts may actually now be pushing the nation closer to the brink of financial ruin.
lead_paragraph: Bets by some of the same banks that helped Greece shroud its mounting debts may actually now be pushing the nation closer to the brink of financial ruin.

headline.main: Banks Bet Greece Defaults on Debt They Helped Hide
headline.print_headline: Banks Bet Greece Defaults on Debt They Helped Hide

byline.original: By Nelson D. Schwartz and Eric Dash

abstract: Lehman Brothers Holdings has agreed with JPMorgan Chase to settle about $7.68 billion in collateral obligations that were pending following Lehman’s bankruptcy filing in 2008, Reuters reported.
snippet: Lehman Brothers Holdings has agreed with JPMorgan Chase to settle about $7.68 billion in collateral obligations that were pending following Lehman’s bankruptcy filing in 2008, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: Lehman Brothers Holdings has agreed with JPMorgan Chase to settle about $7.68 billion in collateral obligations that were pending after Lehman’s bankruptcy filing in 2008, Reuters reported, citing court documents.

headline.main: Lehman Settles Collateral Claims With JPMorgan

abstract: JPMorgan Chase has named Anwar Zakkour, a veteran deal-maker, as its new head of technology mergers and acquisitions, according to an internal memorandum obtained by DealBook.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase has named Anwar Zakkour, a veteran deal-maker, as its new head of technology mergers and acquisitions, according to an internal memorandum obtained by DealBook.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase has named Anwar Zakkour, a veteran deal-maker, as its new head of technology mergers and acquisitions, according to an internal memorandum obtained by DealBook.

headline.main: JPMorgan Names New Tech M.&A. Head

abstract: James E. Staley, JPMorgan Chase’s investment banking chief, acknowledged Thursday that regulatory changes being considered in Congress had influenced the bank’s acquisition strategy, in a sign that the bank may be growing more concerned about the impact of tougher rules for financial firms.
snippet: James E. Staley, JPMorgan Chase’s investment banking chief, acknowledged Thursday that regulatory changes being considered in Congress had influenced the bank’s acquisition strategy, in a sign that the bank may be growing more concerned about the ...
lead_paragraph: James E. Staley, JPMorgan Chase‘s investment banking chief, acknowledged Thursday that regulatory changes being considered in Congress had influenced the bank’s acquisition strategy, in a sign that the bank may be growing more concerned about the impact of tougher rules for financial firms.

headline.main: JPMorgan Shows Its Concern About New Bank Rules
